data.title: NCNPS
data.meta_description: تنظيم القطاع غير الربحي والإشراف عليه، وتمكين الشركاء والمنظمات المرتبطة بالقطاع غير الربحي من تأدية أدوارهم بما ينمّي القطاع.
data.text:
About

The National Center for Non-Profit Sector was established by Cabinet Resolution No. 459 on 16/4/2019. It is its own entity, financially and administratively independent, and directly linked to (and influenced by) the Prime Minister. The Center aims to organize and activate non-profit sector organizations by contributing to their development, equipping them with government licensing, and supervising their financial and administrative operations.

Developing a strong and sustainable non-profit sector (a Vision 2030 goal that falls under the National Transformation Program umbrella) will have a positive and profound effect on the nation, both on social and economic levels, and further stimulate our collective growth and progress – as a country and as a people.

Our partners (government agencies, non-profit organizations, corporations, and individuals) will work alongside the Center and in line with comprehensive governance to achieve our goals efficiently, effectively, and with ample results, thereby providing the nation’s residents with safe and reliable platforms through which they can contribute to the country’s people and to humanity at as a whole.

H.E. Eng. Ahmad bin Sulaiman AlRajhi, is the Minister of Human Resources and Social Development in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. In 2018, he was appointed the Minister of Labor and Social Development. In 2020, a royal order was issued to merge the Ministry of Civil Service with the Ministry of Labor and Social Development to become the Ministry of Human Recourses and Social Development.

Eng. AlRajhi is the Chairman of the Board of a number of public entities including; the Human Resources Development Fund (HADAF), the Social Development Bank, the General Authority of Awqaf, the Charity Orphans Care Foundation (Ekhaa), the National Committee for the Care of Prisoners and their Families, and Ex-convicts (Tarahum), the Family Affairs Council, the Princess Seetah Bin Abdulaziz Award for Excellence in Social Work, the Authority for the Care of People with Disabilities, the National Center for Social Studies, the Institute of Public Administration, Takamol Holding, Future Work Company, the National Center for Non-Profit Sector and the Occupational Health and Safety Council.

Eng. AlRajhi is in charge of the legal and administrative legislations of the Saudi labor market, and the legislations necessary for the growth of the non-profit sector. He has a vast administrative and institutional experience acquired from his role as founder, chairman and member of many major companies and local and international factories, as well as his experience in philanthropy through leading many charitable organizations. He was also previously the chairman of the Federation of Saudi Chambers, the chairman of Riyadh Chamber of Commerce & Industry, vice-chairman of the Federation of GCC Chambers, and a member of many governmental bodies and entities.

AlRajhi has an exceptional vision supported by extensive experience in the governmental, commercial and charity fields that helped develop the Saudi labor market and the non-profit sectors.

AlRajhi holds a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering from King Fahad University of Petroleum and Minerals.

Ahmed bin Ali Al-Suwailem is the CEO of the National Center for the Development of the Non-Profit Sector since January 2022. Al-Suwailem has more than 20 years of experience in the public and private sectors in a number of specializations such as economics, trade, finance and banking.

Prior to his executive presidency of the National Center for the Development of the Non-Profit Sector, Al-Suwailem assumed a number of leadership roles, as he was the CEO of the National Program for Combating Commercial Concealment in the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, Advisor to His Excellency the Saudi Minister of Commerce, Secretary General of the Riyadh Chamber in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Managing Director and member of the Board of Directors Riyadh International Conference Center in the Kingdom, and Executive Financial Director at Gulf International Bank. He was also Executive Vice President of Financial Control at the Saudi International Investment Bank, and a member of the Executive Committee of the Saudi Chambers of Commerce Development Program.

Al-Suwailem holds a Master’s degree in Finance from George Washington University in the United States of America, and a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting from King Saud University in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. He is a certified management accountant from the American Institute of Management Accountants (CMA). Al-Suwailem also holds a fellowship from the Saudi Organization for Saudi Accountants (CPA), a fellowship in International Financial Reporting Standards (CertIFRS), and an accredited certificate in exhibition and conference management (CME) from the International Association of Exhibitions and Events (IAEE).
